trans-unit.source: Get started with a Hadoop emulator for HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with a Hadoop emulator for HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use an installed emulator with a MapReduce tutorial and other samples to learn the Hadoop ecosystem. HDInsight emulator works like a Hadoop sandbox.
trans-unit.target: Use an installed emulator with a MapReduce tutorial and other samples to learn the Hadoop ecosystem. HDInsight emulator works like a Hadoop sandbox.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial gets you started with Hadoop clusters in the Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure (formerly HDInsight Server Developer Preview).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial gets you started with Hadoop clusters in the Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure (formerly HDInsight Server Developer Preview).

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator comes with the same components from the Hadoop ecosystem as Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator comes with the same components from the Hadoop ecosystem as Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For details, including information on the versions deployed, see <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details, including information on the versions deployed, see <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once the emulator is installed, you follow a MapReduce tutorial for word count and then run samples.
trans-unit.target: Once the emulator is installed, you follow a MapReduce tutorial for word count and then run samples.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator includes only a Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator includes only a Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: It does not include HBase or Storm.
trans-unit.target: It does not include HBase or Storm.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator provides a local development environment much like a Hadoop sandbox.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator provides a local development environment much like a Hadoop sandbox.

trans-unit.source: If you are familiar with Hadoop, you can get started with the HDInsight Emulator by using the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS).
trans-unit.target: If you are familiar with Hadoop, you can get started with the HDInsight Emulator by using the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS).

trans-unit.source: In HDInsight, the default file system is Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: In HDInsight, the default file system is Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: So eventually, you will want to develop your jobs by using Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: So eventually, you will want to develop your jobs by using Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Blob storage with the HDInsight Emulator, you must make changes to the configuration of the emulator.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Blob storage with the HDInsight Emulator, you must make changes to the configuration of the emulator.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator can use only a single node deployment.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator can use only a single node deployment.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator requires a 64-bit version of Windows.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator requires a 64-bit version of Windows.

trans-unit.source: One of the following requirements must be satisfied:
trans-unit.target: One of the following requirements must be satisfied:

trans-unit.source: Windows 7 Service Pack 1
trans-unit.target: Windows 7 Service Pack 1

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 1
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 1

trans-unit.source: Windows 8
trans-unit.target: Windows 8

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft HDInsight Emulator is installable via the Microsoft Web Platform Installer.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft HDInsight Emulator is installable via the Microsoft Web Platform Installer.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator currently supports only English operating systems.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator currently supports only English operating systems.

trans-unit.source: If you have a previous version of the emulator installed, you must uninstall the following two components from Control Panel/Programs and Features before installing the latest version of the emulator:
trans-unit.target: If you have a previous version of the emulator installed, you must uninstall the following two components from Control Panel/Programs and Features before installing the latest version of the emulator:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure or HDInsight Developer Preview, whichever is installed
trans-unit.target: Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure or HDInsight Developer Preview, whichever is installed

trans-unit.source: Hortonworks Data Platform
trans-unit.target: Hortonworks Data Platform

trans-unit.source: To install the HDInsight Emulator
trans-unit.target: To install the HDInsight Emulator

trans-unit.source: Open Internet Explorer, and then browse to the <linkText>Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure installation page[hdinsight-emulator-install]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Open Internet Explorer, and then browse to the <linkText>Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure installation page[hdinsight-emulator-install]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Install Now.
trans-unit.target: Click Install Now.

trans-unit.source: Click Run when prompted for the installation of HDINSIGHT.exe at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Run when prompted for the installation of HDINSIGHT.exe at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Yes button in the User Account Control window that pops up to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Click the Yes button in the User Account Control window that pops up to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: The Web Platform Installer window appears.
trans-unit.target: The Web Platform Installer window appears.

trans-unit.source: Click Install on the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Install on the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click I Accept to agree to the licensing terms.
trans-unit.target: Click I Accept to agree to the licensing terms.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the Web Platform Installer shows The following products were successfully installed, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the Web Platform Installer shows The following products were successfully installed, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Click Exit to close the Web Platform Installer window.
trans-unit.target: Click Exit to close the Web Platform Installer window.

trans-unit.source: To verify the HDInsight Emulator installation
trans-unit.target: To verify the HDInsight Emulator installation

trans-unit.source: The installation should have installed three icons on your desktop.
trans-unit.target: The installation should have installed three icons on your desktop.

trans-unit.source: The three icons are linked as follows:
trans-unit.target: The three icons are linked as follows:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop Command Line - The Hadoop command prompt from which MapReduce, Pig and Hive jobs are run in the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop Command Line - The Hadoop command prompt from which MapReduce, Pig and Hive jobs are run in the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop NameNode Status - The NameNode maintains a tree-based directory for all the files in HDFS.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop NameNode Status - The NameNode maintains a tree-based directory for all the files in HDFS.

trans-unit.source: It also keeps track of where the data for all the files are kept in a Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: It also keeps track of where the data for all the files are kept in a Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: Clients communicate with the NameNode in order to figure out where the data nodes for all the files are stored.
trans-unit.target: Clients communicate with the NameNode in order to figure out where the data nodes for all the files are stored.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop Yarn Status - The job tracker that allocates MapReduce tasks to nodes in a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop Yarn Status - The job tracker that allocates MapReduce tasks to nodes in a cluster.

trans-unit.source: The installation should have also installed several local services.
trans-unit.target: The installation should have also installed several local services.

trans-unit.source: The following is a screenshot of the Services window:
trans-unit.target: The following is a screenshot of the Services window:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hadoop ecosystem services listed in the emulator window.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hadoop ecosystem services listed in the emulator window.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The services related to the HDInsight Emulator are not started by default.
trans-unit.target: The services related to the HDInsight Emulator are not started by default.

trans-unit.source: To start the services, from the Hadoop command line, run start\_local\_hdp_services.cmd under C:\hdp (default location).
trans-unit.target: To start the services, from the Hadoop command line, run start\_local\_hdp_services.cmd under C:\hdp (default location).

trans-unit.source: To automatically start the services after the computer restarts, run set-onebox-autostart.cmd.
trans-unit.target: To automatically start the services after the computer restarts, run set-onebox-autostart.cmd.

trans-unit.source: For known issues with installing and running the HDInsight Emulator, see the <linkText>HDInsight Emulator Release Notes</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For known issues with installing and running the HDInsight Emulator, see the <linkText>HDInsight Emulator Release Notes</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The installation log is located at C:\HadoopFeaturePackSetup\HadoopFeaturePackSetupTools\gettingStarted.winpkg.install.log.
trans-unit.target: The installation log is located at C:\HadoopFeaturePackSetup\HadoopFeaturePackSetupTools\gettingStarted.winpkg.install.log.

trans-unit.source: You can use HDInsight tools for Visual Studio to connect to the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can use HDInsight tools for Visual Studio to connect to the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to use the Visual Studio tools with HDInsight clusters on Azure, see <linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to use the Visual Studio tools with HDInsight clusters on Azure, see <linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to install the HDInsight Visual Studio tools, see <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to install the HDInsight Visual Studio tools, see <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: From the View menu, click Server Explorer to open the Server Explorer window.
trans-unit.target: From the View menu, click Server Explorer to open the Server Explorer window.

trans-unit.source: Expand Azure, right-click HDInsight, and then click Connect to HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Expand Azure, right-click HDInsight, and then click Connect to HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio view: Connect to HDInsight emulator on menu.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio view: Connect to HDInsight emulator on menu.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to HDInsight Emulator dialog box, verify the values for WebHCat, HiveServer2, and WebHDFS endpoints, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to HDInsight Emulator dialog box, verify the values for WebHCat, HiveServer2, and WebHDFS endpoints, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The values populated by default should work if you did not make any changes to the default configuration of the Emulator.
trans-unit.target: The values populated by default should work if you did not make any changes to the default configuration of the Emulator.

trans-unit.source: If you made any changes, update the values in the dialog box and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: If you made any changes, update the values in the dialog box and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to HDInsight emulator dialog box with settings.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to HDInsight emulator dialog box with settings.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the connection is successfully established, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Once the connection is successfully established, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the HDInsight Emulator in the Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the HDInsight Emulator in the Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Explorer showing HDInsight local emulator - a Hadoop sanbox - connected.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Explorer showing HDInsight local emulator - a Hadoop sanbox - connected.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the connection is successfully established, you can use the HDInsight VS tools with Emulator, just like you would use it with an Azure HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once the connection is successfully established, you can use the HDInsight VS tools with Emulator, just like you would use it with an Azure HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use VS tools with Azure HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use VS tools with Azure HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: While connecting to the HDInsight Emulator, even though the dialog box shows that HiveServer2 connected successfully, you must manually set hive.security.authorization.enabled property to false in the Hive configuration file at C:\hdp\hive-version\conf\hive-site.xml, and then restart the local Emulator.
trans-unit.target: While connecting to the HDInsight Emulator, even though the dialog box shows that HiveServer2 connected successfully, you must manually set hive.security.authorization.enabled property to false in the Hive configuration file at C:\hdp\hive-version\conf\hive-site.xml, and then restart the local Emulator.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio connects to HiveServer2 only when you are previewing the top 100 rows of your table.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio connects to HiveServer2 only when you are previewing the top 100 rows of your table.

trans-unit.source: If you do not intend to use such a query, you can leave hive configuration as-is.
trans-unit.target: If you do not intend to use such a query, you can leave hive configuration as-is.

trans-unit.source: If you are using dynamic IP allocation (DHCP) on the computer running the HDInsight Emulator, you might need to update C:\hdp\hadoop-version\etc\hadoop\core-site.xml and change the value of property hadoop.proxyuser.hadoop.hosts to (*).
trans-unit.target: If you are using dynamic IP allocation (DHCP) on the computer running the HDInsight Emulator, you might need to update C:\hdp\hadoop-version\etc\hadoop\core-site.xml and change the value of property hadoop.proxyuser.hadoop.hosts to (*).

trans-unit.source: This enables Hadoop user to connect from all hosts to impersonate the user you entered in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This enables Hadoop user to connect from all hosts to impersonate the user you entered in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: You might get an error when Visual Studio tries to connect to WebHCat service (“error”: “Could not find job jobXXXX0001”).
trans-unit.target: You might get an error when Visual Studio tries to connect to WebHCat service (“error”: “Could not find job jobXXXX0001”).

trans-unit.source: In this case, you must restart the WebHCat service and try again.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you must restart the WebHCat service and try again.

trans-unit.source: To restart the WebHCat service, start the Services MMC, right-click Apache Hadoop Templeton (this is the old name for WebHCat service), and click Restart.
trans-unit.target: To restart the WebHCat service, start the Services MMC, right-click Apache Hadoop Templeton (this is the old name for WebHCat service), and click Restart.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have the HDInsight Emulator configured on your workstation, try this MapReduce tutorial to test the installation.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have the HDInsight Emulator configured on your workstation, try this MapReduce tutorial to test the installation.

trans-unit.source: You will first upload some data files to HDFS, and then run a word count MapReduce job to count the frequency of specific words in those files.
trans-unit.target: You will first upload some data files to HDFS, and then run a word count MapReduce job to count the frequency of specific words in those files.

trans-unit.source: The word-counting MapReduce program has been packaged into hadoop-mapreduce-examples-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981.jar.
trans-unit.target: The word-counting MapReduce program has been packaged into hadoop-mapreduce-examples-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981.jar.

trans-unit.source: The jar file is located at the C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\hadoop\mapreduce folder.
trans-unit.target: The jar file is located at the C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\share\hadoop\mapreduce folder.

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job to count words takes two arguments:
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job to count words takes two arguments:

trans-unit.source: An input folder.
trans-unit.target: An input folder.

trans-unit.source: You will use hdfs://localhost/user/HDIUser as the input folder.
trans-unit.target: You will use hdfs://localhost/user/HDIUser as the input folder.

trans-unit.source: An output folder.
trans-unit.target: An output folder.

trans-unit.source: You will use hdfs://localhost/user/HDIUser/WordCount_Output as the output folder.
trans-unit.target: You will use hdfs://localhost/user/HDIUser/WordCount_Output as the output folder.

trans-unit.source: The output folder cannot be an existing folder, or the MapReduce job will fail.
trans-unit.target: The output folder cannot be an existing folder, or the MapReduce job will fail.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run the MapReduce job for the second time, you must either specify a different output folder or delete the existing output folder.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run the MapReduce job for the second time, you must either specify a different output folder or delete the existing output folder.

trans-unit.source: To run the word-count MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To run the word-count MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click Hadoop Command Line to open the Hadoop command-line window.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click Hadoop Command Line to open the Hadoop command-line window.

trans-unit.source: The current folder should be:
trans-unit.target: The current folder should be:

trans-unit.source: If not, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: If not, run the following command:

trans-unit.target: Run the following Hadoop commands to make an HDFS folder for storing the input and output files:

trans-unit.source: Run the following Hadoop command to copy some local text files to HDFS:
trans-unit.target: Run the following Hadoop command to copy some local text files to HDFS:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to list the files in the /user/HDIUser folder:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to list the files in the /user/HDIUser folder:

trans-unit.source: You should see the following files:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following files:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to run the word-count MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to run the word-count MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to list the number of words with "windows" in them from the output file:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to list the number of words with "windows" in them from the output file:

trans-unit.source: The output should be:
trans-unit.target: The output should be:

trans-unit.source: For more information on Hadoop commands, see <linkText>Hadoop commands manual[hadoop-commands-manual]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Hadoop commands, see <linkText>Hadoop commands manual[hadoop-commands-manual]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator installation provides some samples to get users started with learning Apache Hadoop-based services on Windows.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator installation provides some samples to get users started with learning Apache Hadoop-based services on Windows.

trans-unit.source: These samples cover some tasks that are typically needed when processing a big dataset.
trans-unit.target: These samples cover some tasks that are typically needed when processing a big dataset.

trans-unit.source: Building on the MapReduce tutorial above, the the samples will help you become more familiar with the MapReduce programming model and its ecosystem.
trans-unit.target: Building on the MapReduce tutorial above, the the samples will help you become more familiar with the MapReduce programming model and its ecosystem.

trans-unit.source: The sample data is organized around processing IIS World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) log data.
trans-unit.target: The sample data is organized around processing IIS World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) log data.

trans-unit.source: A data generation tool is provided to create and import the datasets in various sizes to HDFS or Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: A data generation tool is provided to create and import the datasets in various sizes to HDFS or Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: (See <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage for HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information).
trans-unit.target: (See <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage for HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information).

trans-unit.source: MapReduce, Pig, or Hive jobs can then be run on the pages of data generated by the Azure PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: MapReduce, Pig, or Hive jobs can then be run on the pages of data generated by the Azure PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: Pig and Hive scripts are a layer of abstraction over MapReduce, and eventually compile to MapReduce programs.
trans-unit.target: Pig and Hive scripts are a layer of abstraction over MapReduce, and eventually compile to MapReduce programs.

trans-unit.source: You can run a series of jobs to observe the effects of using these different technologies and how the data size affects the execution of the processing tasks.
trans-unit.target: You can run a series of jobs to observe the effects of using these different technologies and how the data size affects the execution of the processing tasks.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The IIS W3C log-data scenario</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The IIS W3C log-data scenario</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Load sample W3C log data</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Load sample W3C log data</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Run Java MapReduce job</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Run Java MapReduce job</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Run Hive job</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Run Hive job</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Run Pig job</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Run Pig job</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Rebuild the samples</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Rebuild the samples</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The W3C scenario generates and imports IIS W3C log data in three sizes into HDFS or Azure Blob storage: 1MB (small), 500MB (medium), and 2GB (large).
trans-unit.target: The W3C scenario generates and imports IIS W3C log data in three sizes into HDFS or Azure Blob storage: 1MB (small), 500MB (medium), and 2GB (large).

trans-unit.source: It provides three job types and implements each of them in C#, Java, Pig and Hive.
trans-unit.target: It provides three job types and implements each of them in C#, Java, Pig and Hive.

trans-unit.source: totalhits - Calculates the total number of requests for a given page.
trans-unit.target: totalhits - Calculates the total number of requests for a given page.

trans-unit.source: avgtime - Calculates the average time taken (in seconds) for a request per page.
trans-unit.target: avgtime - Calculates the average time taken (in seconds) for a request per page.

trans-unit.source: errors - Calculates the number of errors per page, per hour, for requests whose status was 404 or 500.
trans-unit.target: errors - Calculates the number of errors per page, per hour, for requests whose status was 404 or 500.

trans-unit.source: These samples and their documentation do not provide an in-depth study or full implementation of the key Hadoop technologies.
trans-unit.target: These samples and their documentation do not provide an in-depth study or full implementation of the key Hadoop technologies.

trans-unit.source: The cluster used has only a single node and so the effect of adding more nodes cannot, with this release, be observed.
trans-unit.target: The cluster used has only a single node and so the effect of adding more nodes cannot, with this release, be observed.

trans-unit.source: Generating and importing the data to HDFS is done via the Azure PowerShell script importdata.ps1.
trans-unit.target: Generating and importing the data to HDFS is done via the Azure PowerShell script importdata.ps1.

trans-unit.source: To import sample W3C log data
trans-unit.target: To import sample W3C log data

trans-unit.source: Open a Hadoop command line from the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open a Hadoop command line from the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to generate and import data to HDFS:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to generate and import data to HDFS:

trans-unit.source: If you want to load data into Azure Blob storage instead, see <linkText>Connect to Azure Blob storage</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to load data into Azure Blob storage instead, see <linkText>Connect to Azure Blob storage</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command from the Hadoop command line to list the imported files on HDFS:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command from the Hadoop command line to list the imported files on HDFS:

trans-unit.source: The output should be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The output should be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: If you want to verify the file contents, run the following command to display one of the data files to the console window:
trans-unit.target: If you want to verify the file contents, run the following command to display one of the data files to the console window:

trans-unit.source: You now have the data files created and imported to HDFS.
trans-unit.target: You now have the data files created and imported to HDFS.

trans-unit.source: You can start running different Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can start running different Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: MapReduce is the basic compute engine for Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: MapReduce is the basic compute engine for Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: By default, it is implemented in Java, but there are also examples that leverage .NET and Hadoop Streaming that use C#.
trans-unit.target: By default, it is implemented in Java, but there are also examples that leverage .NET and Hadoop Streaming that use C#.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for running a MapReduce job is:
trans-unit.target: The syntax for running a MapReduce job is:

trans-unit.source: The jar file and the source files are located in the C:\Hadoop\GettingStarted\Java folder.
trans-unit.target: The jar file and the source files are located in the C:\Hadoop\GettingStarted\Java folder.

trans-unit.source: To run a MapReduce job for calculating webpage hits
trans-unit.target: To run a MapReduce job for calculating webpage hits

trans-unit.source: Open the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to remove the output directory in case the folder exists.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to remove the output directory in case the folder exists.

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job will fail if the output folder already exists.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job will fail if the output folder already exists.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the command:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the command:

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: w3c_scenarios.jar
trans-unit.target: w3c_scenarios.jar

trans-unit.source: The jar file is located in the C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Java folder.
trans-unit.target: The jar file is located in the C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Java folder.

trans-unit.source: microsoft.hadoop.w3c.TotalHitsForPage

trans-unit.source: The Hive query engine might feel familiar to analysts with strong Structured Query Language (SQL) skills.
trans-unit.target: The Hive query engine might feel familiar to analysts with strong Structured Query Language (SQL) skills.

trans-unit.source: It provides a SQL-like interface and a relational data model for HDFS.
trans-unit.target: It provides a SQL-like interface and a relational data model for HDFS.

trans-unit.source: Hive uses a language called HiveQL, which is very similar to SQL.
trans-unit.target: Hive uses a language called HiveQL, which is very similar to SQL.

trans-unit.source: Hive provides a layer of abstraction over the Java-based MapReduce framework, and the Hive queries are compiled to MapReduce at run time.
trans-unit.target: Hive provides a layer of abstraction over the Java-based MapReduce framework, and the Hive queries are compiled to MapReduce at run time.

trans-unit.source: To run a Hive job
trans-unit.target: To run a Hive job

trans-unit.source: Open a Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: Open a Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to C:\hdp\GettingStarted.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to remove the /w3c/hive/input folder in case the folder exists.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to remove the /w3c/hive/input folder in case the folder exists.

trans-unit.source: The Hive job will fail if the folder exists.
trans-unit.target: The Hive job will fail if the folder exists.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create the /w3c/hive/input folders and then copy the data files to the /hive/input folder:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create the /w3c/hive/input folders and then copy the data files to the /hive/input folder:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to execute the w3ccreate.hql script file.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to execute the w3ccreate.hql script file.

trans-unit.source: The script creates a Hive table, and loads data to the Hive table:
trans-unit.target: The script creates a Hive table, and loads data to the Hive table:

trans-unit.source: At this stage, you can also use the HDInsight Visual Studio tools to run the Hive query.
trans-unit.target: At this stage, you can also use the HDInsight Visual Studio tools to run the Hive query.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio, create a new Project, and from the HDInsight template, select Hive Application.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio, create a new Project, and from the HDInsight template, select Hive Application.

trans-unit.source: Once the project opens, add the query as a new item.
trans-unit.target: Once the project opens, add the query as a new item.

trans-unit.source: The query is available at C:/hdp/GettingStarted/Hive/w3c.
trans-unit.target: The query is available at C:/hdp/GettingStarted/Hive/w3c.

trans-unit.source: Once the query is added to the project, replace ${hiveconf:input} with /w3c/hive/input, and then press Submit.
trans-unit.target: Once the query is added to the project, replace ${hiveconf:input} with /w3c/hive/input, and then press Submit.

trans-unit.source: The output shall be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The output shall be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to run the w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql HiveQL script file:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to run the w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql HiveQL script file:

trans-unit.source: As explained earlier, you can run this query using the HDInsight Visual Studio Tools as well.
trans-unit.target: As explained earlier, you can run this query using the HDInsight Visual Studio Tools as well.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the command:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the command:

trans-unit.target: File

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\hive-0.13.0.2.1.3.0-1981\bin\hive.cmd

trans-unit.source: The Hive command script.
trans-unit.target: The Hive command script.

trans-unit.source: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Hive\w3c\w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql
trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Hive\w3c\w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql

trans-unit.source: You can substitute the Hive script file with one of the following:
trans-unit.target: You can substitute the Hive script file with one of the following:

trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Hive\w3c\w3cerrorsbypage.hql

trans-unit.source: The w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql HiveQL script is:
trans-unit.target: The w3ctotalhitsbypage.hql HiveQL script is:

trans-unit.target: The end of the output shall be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Note that as a first step in each of the jobs, a table will be created and data will be loaded into the table from the file created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Note that as a first step in each of the jobs, a table will be created and data will be loaded into the table from the file created earlier.

trans-unit.source: You can browse the file that was created by looking under the /Hive node in HDFS, using the following command:
trans-unit.target: You can browse the file that was created by looking under the /Hive node in HDFS, using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Pig processing uses a data-flow language called Pig Latin.
trans-unit.target: Pig processing uses a data-flow language called Pig Latin.

trans-unit.source: Pig Latin abstractions provide richer data structures than MapReduce, and perform for Hadoop what SQL performs for relational database management systems.
trans-unit.target: Pig Latin abstractions provide richer data structures than MapReduce, and perform for Hadoop what SQL performs for relational database management systems.

trans-unit.source: To run the pig jobs
trans-unit.target: To run the pig jobs

trans-unit.source: Open a Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: Open a Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to the C:\hdp\GettingStarted folder.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to the C:\hdp\GettingStarted folder.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to submit a Pig job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to submit a Pig job:

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the elements of the command:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the elements of the command:

trans-unit.source: File
trans-unit.target: File

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The Pig command script.
trans-unit.target: The Pig command script.

trans-unit.source: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\TotalHitsForPage.pig
trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\TotalHitsForPage.pig

trans-unit.source: You can substitute the Pig Latin script file with one of the following:
trans-unit.target: You can substitute the Pig Latin script file with one of the following:

trans-unit.source: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\AverageTimeTaken.pig
trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\AverageTimeTaken.pig

trans-unit.source: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\ErrorsByPage.pig
trans-unit.target: C:\hdp\GettingStarted\Pig\w3c\ErrorsByPage.pig

trans-unit.source: /w3c/input/small/data_w3c_small.txt
trans-unit.target: /w3c/input/small/data_w3c_small.txt

trans-unit.source: You can substitute the parameter with a larger file:
trans-unit.target: You can substitute the parameter with a larger file:

trans-unit.source: /w3c/input/medium/data_w3c_medium.txt
trans-unit.target: /w3c/input/medium/data_w3c_medium.txt

trans-unit.source: /w3c/input/large/data_w3c_large.txt
trans-unit.target: /w3c/input/large/data_w3c_large.txt

trans-unit.source: The output should be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The output should be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Note that since Pig scripts compile to MapReduce jobs, and potentially to more than one such job, you might see multiple MapReduce jobs executing in the course of processing a Pig job.
trans-unit.target: Note that since Pig scripts compile to MapReduce jobs, and potentially to more than one such job, you might see multiple MapReduce jobs executing in the course of processing a Pig job.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Emulator uses HDFS as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Emulator uses HDFS as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: However, Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: However, Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage instead of local storage.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to configure the HDInsight Emulator to use Azure Blob storage instead of local storage.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to create a storage container in Azure and to connect it to the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to create a storage container in Azure and to connect it to the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you start with the instructions below, you must have created a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Before you start with the instructions below, you must have created a storage account.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>How To Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>How To Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create a container
trans-unit.target: To create a container

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW on the left, click Data + Storage, and then click Storage.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW on the left, click Data + Storage, and then click Storage.

trans-unit.source: In the Storage Account blade, configure the properties as shown in the screen capture below.
trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account blade, configure the properties as shown in the screen capture below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a storage account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a storage account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Pin to Startboard, and the click Create.
trans-unit.target: Select Pin to Startboard, and the click Create.

trans-unit.source: Once the storage account is created, from the new storage account blade, click Containers to open the containers blade, click Add.
trans-unit.target: Once the storage account is created, from the new storage account blade, click Containers to open the containers blade, click Add.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the container and then click Select.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the container and then click Select.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a container</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a container</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Before you can access an Azure Storage account, you must add the account name and the account key to the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Before you can access an Azure Storage account, you must add the account name and the account key to the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: To configure the connection to an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: To configure the connection to an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Open C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\etc\hadoop\core-site.xml in Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Open C:\hdp\hadoop-2.4.0.2.1.3.0-1981\etc\hadoop\core-site.xml in Notepad.

trans-unit.source: Add the following <property\> tag next to the other <property\> tags:
trans-unit.target: Add the following <property\> tag next to the other <property\> tags:

trans-unit.source: You must substitute <StorageAccountName\> and <StorageAccountKey\> with the values that match your Storage account information.
trans-unit.target: You must substitute <StorageAccountName\> and <StorageAccountKey\> with the values that match your Storage account information.

trans-unit.source: Save the change.
trans-unit.target: Save the change.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to restart the Hadoop services.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to restart the Hadoop services.

trans-unit.source: Use the following syntax to access the Storage account:
trans-unit.target: Use the following syntax to access the Storage account:

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Some of the Azure PowerShell cmdlets are also supported on the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Some of the Azure PowerShell cmdlets are also supported on the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: These cmdlets include:
trans-unit.target: These cmdlets include:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight job definition cmdlets
trans-unit.target: HDInsight job definition cmdlets

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightSqoopJobDefinition
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightSqoopJobDefinition

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightStreamingMapReduceJobDefinition
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightStreamingMapReduceJobDefinition

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightPigJobDefinition
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightPigJobDefinition

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightHiveJobDefinition
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightHiveJobDefinition

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightMapReduceJobDefinition
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightMapReduceJobDefinition

trans-unit.source: Start-AzureHDInsightJob
trans-unit.target: Start-AzureHDInsightJob

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureHDInsightJob
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureHDInsightJob

trans-unit.source: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob
trans-unit.target: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample for submitting a Hadoop job:
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample for submitting a Hadoop job:

trans-unit.source: You will get a prompt when calling Get-Credential.
trans-unit.target: You will get a prompt when calling Get-Credential.

trans-unit.source: You must use hadoop as the user name.
trans-unit.target: You must use hadoop as the user name.

trans-unit.source: The password can be any string.
trans-unit.target: The password can be any string.

trans-unit.source: The cluster name is always http://localhost:50111.
trans-unit.target: The cluster name is always http://localhost:50111.

trans-unit.source: For more information about submitting Hadoop jobs, see <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about submitting Hadoop jobs, see <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure PowerShell cmdlets for HDInsight, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference[hdinsight-powershell-reference]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure PowerShell cmdlets for HDInsight, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference[hdinsight-powershell-reference]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the computer where you have the emulator installed, open Control Panel and under Programs, click Uninstall a Program.
trans-unit.target: On the computer where you have the emulator installed, open Control Panel and under Programs, click Uninstall a Program.

trans-unit.source: From the list of installed programs, right-click Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure, and then click Uninstall.
trans-unit.target: From the list of installed programs, right-click Microsoft HDInsight Emulator for Azure, and then click Uninstall.

trans-unit.source: In this MapReduce tutorial, you installed the HDInsight Emulator - a Hadoop sandbox - and ran some Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: In this MapReduce tutorial, you installed the HDInsight Emulator - a Hadoop sandbox - and ran some Hadoop jobs.
